title: L’Oréal Is Changing the Face of Its U.S. Business to Boost Sales
text:
French cosmetics giant L’Oréal had a rare misstep in July after missing consensus sales-growth forecasts for the second quarter, but its fundamentals remain solid, and it’s a strong long-term bet.

The world’s biggest beauty firm last week took steps to boost sales growth after demand slowed for makeup in the U.S., including changing its top executive there. L’Oréal CEO Jean-Paul Agon told Barron’s that the growth in makeup would ‘‘reaccelerate’’ with new products and repositioning of brands. “We are doing everything to restimulate...
description: The French cosmetics giant has changed its top executive at the U.S. division. The stock remains a strong long-term bet.
